page.title: 13Wildlife in our Block.
page.content: Our Block being a rural area is very rich in wildlife. The commonest creatures found are;foxes,field mice,grass snakes ,frogs toads,moles,and shrews.The foxes are becoming quite tame and can frequently can be found living under people's sheds.They frequently raid dustbins.The badgers were gassed about 3 years ago,but numbers are again on the increase. The area is also rich in birdlife. Here is a list of commonly seen birds; Sparrow Hawks,Kestrels,Wood Pigeons, Blue Tits,Great Tits and lots more. Wild flowers abound also, common species include Bluebells,Dogroses Primroses and Dog Violets.Rarer species found include;Monkshood,Fringe Cup,Lily of the Valley and Lesser Wintergreen.
